figure_1.title: Figure 1.
figure_1.caption: PubMed4Hh Mobile Web Application on the Smartphone Home Screen

figure_2.title: Figure 2.
figure_2.caption: PICO and askMEDLINE (free-text query) with voice input (Siri) screenshot

claims.sentence: Figure 1 shows the interface featuring PICO and askMEDLINE search engines.
Examples of searches are shown in Figure 2.
The relevant citations retrieved (Figure 3), features TBLs (“the bottom-line” summaries), abstracts, and links to full-text articles accessible anywhere the internet is available.

PubMed4Hh was modified from the original version (Gartrell et al., 2018)16 to include:1) PICO query (structured format/voice input search) and askMEDLINE (free-text/voice input search), 2) highlighted key search terms, 3) spell checkers, and 4) an online real-time survey questionnaire for nurses to rate the usefulness of abstracts and TBL summaries (Figure 4).
Figure 1 shows the interface featuring PICO and askMEDLINE search engines.
Examples of searches are shown in Figure 2.
The relevant citations retrieved (Figure 3), features TBLs (“the bottom-line” summaries), abstracts, and links to full-text articles accessible anywhere the internet is available.
